cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 50 miles ESE of Miami, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest across South Florida tonight and Saturday, then turning northwest over the eastern Gulf of Mexico toward the northern Gulf Coast (MS/AL/LA) early next week
cyclone.hours_to_offshore: N/A (system does not approach the South Carolina coast)

weather_observation.watch_coast: South of Jupiter Inlet to north of Ocean Reef, Florida (Atlantic side)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: South and central Florida tonight/Saturday, then northern Gulf Coast from Louisiana eastward to the Florida Panhandle early next week
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: Not expected to approach Port of Charleston within 5-day forecast window
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible; probability of sustained tropical-storm-force winds remains below 10%
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Charleston given distant track in Gulf of Mexico
weather_observation.rainfall: Only light, intermittent showers possible from distant outer moisture
weather_observation.other_hazards: None anticipated that would disrupt port operations
